de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.scenario
Interface Scenario

public interface Scenario

Scenario configures hosts to make them usable for simulator, i.e. mainly creating some initial events. Different implementations may offer different ways to prepare a simulation run.

Version:
3.0, 03.12.2007
Author:
Sebastian Kaune, Konstantin Pussep

Method Summary
 int createActions(java.lang.String groupID, java.lang.String timeInterval, java.lang.String methodName, java.lang.String[] params)
          Create (one or many) actions for a group of hosts (or a single host if group size is one).
 void prepare()
          Prepare the scenario to be started.
 void setHosts(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Host>> allHosts)
          Set all hosts available for this scenario.
 

Method Detail

prepare

void prepare()
Prepare the scenario to be started. Typically, a scenario would schedule some initial simulation events.

setHosts

void setHosts(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<Host>> allHosts)
Set all hosts available for this scenario.

Parameters:
allHosts - - groups of hosts indexed by group ids

createActions

int createActions(java.lang.String groupID,
                  java.lang.String timeInterval,
                  java.lang.String methodName,
                  java.lang.String[] params)
Create (one or many) actions for a group of hosts (or a single host if group size is one).

Parameters:
groupID - - id of the host group
timeInterval - - absolute point of time or an interval (then as "starttime-endtime")
methodName - - method name to execute
params - - list of method params (as strings which will be converted to appropriate types)
Returns:
number of actions created
